rights.description: Designated public records person shall notify applicant within 7 business days from acknowledged receipt
rights.conditions: Receipt of request must be acknowledged
rights.applies_to: All governmental entities with designated public records person
rights.implementation_notes: This is a mandatory acknowledgment timeline - agencies must respond within 7 business days
rights.request_tips: Track receipt date to enforce 7-day acknowledgment deadline

rights.description: All records shall be released not later than 30 calendar days from acknowledged receipt
rights.conditions: Applies unless extension granted for good cause
rights.implementation_notes: This is a hard deadline of 30 calendar days from acknowledgment
rights.request_tips: Cite this 30-day maximum if agency delays beyond acknowledgment plus 30 days

rights.description: Records readily available shall be released immediately unless release would impair or impede agency operations
rights.conditions: Records must be readily available and release must not impair operations
rights.implementation_notes: This creates presumption of immediate release for readily available records
rights.request_tips: For simple requests, cite this provision to demand immediate release of readily available records

rights.description: Each governmental entity shall designate a public records person to respond to requests
rights.implementation_notes: Wyoming Administration and Information maintains directory of designated public records persons
rights.request_tips: Request contact information for designated public records person; directory maintained by state

rights.description: Public Records Ombudsman (Governor-designated) assists public with access and mediates disputes
rights.implementation_notes: Ombudsman provides guidance and assistance before resorting to litigation
rights.request_tips: Contact Public Records Ombudsman through Governor's office for mediation of disputes

rights.description: Court costs and reasonable attorney fees awarded to substantially prevailing petitioner
rights.conditions: Petitioner must substantially prevail in mandamus action
rights.applies_to: Requesters who file successful mandamus petitions
rights.implementation_notes: This provides financial incentive for agencies to comply rather than litigate
rights.request_tips: If considering litigation, know that attorney fees are recoverable if you substantially prevail

rights.description: Law does not require identification or statement of purpose; any person has right of inspection
rights.conditions: No conditions - applies to all requests
rights.implementation_notes: Written request recommended but purpose statement not required
rights.request_tips: You are not required to identify yourself or state your purpose for requesting records

rights.description: Electronic records have same status as physical records; may request in electronic format
rights.conditions: Reasonable fees may apply for electronic formatting
rights.implementation_notes: Agencies cannot deny access to electronic records or refuse electronic format
rights.request_tips: Request records in electronic format to reduce copy fees; cite parity provision

rights.description: Custodian shall allow any person the right of inspection of records during business hours
rights.conditions: Must be during agency business hours
rights.implementation_notes: Right to inspect is fundamental and must be accommodated
rights.request_tips: You have right to inspect records in person during business hours without copying fees

rights.description: Governmental entity bears burden of proving exemption applies
rights.implementation_notes: Agency must prove exemption - requester does not have burden to prove entitlement
rights.request_tips: If denied, agency must justify exemption; you do not have to prove your right to access

validation_metadata.notes: All rights extracted from verified jurisdiction-data.json file. Each right corresponds to specific statutory provisions in Wyoming Public Records Act.
